bibl.title: Letter from Robert M. O'Reilly to S. C. Meade, March 13, 1907

div1.p: O'Reilly informs Meade that the Walter Reed Memorial Fund has increased Emilie Lawrence Reed's pension, that James Carroll has been promoted to Major, and that Mabel H. Lazear has been minimally compensated for her husband's work. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Robert M. O'Reilly to S. C. Meade, March 13, 1907

WAR DEPARTMENT
WAR DEPARTMENT,
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL,
WASHINGTON.
March 13, 1907
Mr. S. C. Meade,
Secretary, The Merchants' Association of New York,
62-72 Lafayette Street,
New York City, N.Y.
Sir:
div1.p:
In reply to your letter of the 11th instant, I have the
honor to enclose you herewith a memorandum prepared for the
President last Summer, which gives a history of the investiga-
tions in Cuba which resulted in the demonstration that yellow
fever is transmitted by a species of mosquito. Since the
preparation of this memorandum the Walter Reed Memorial Fund
has been raised to $25,000, and the interest on this money
will be paid to Mrs. Reed during her lifetime. This, with her
pension of $125 a month, makes her income something over $200
a month. I am not informed as to what means she has outside
of this income, but believe Major Reed left some small property
in life insurance.

On December 5, 1906, the President sent a special message
to Congress asking that proper steps be taken to recognize the
great work done in Cuba by the Yellow Fever Commission, and in
compliance with his recommendation Congress passed a bill pro-
moting Frist Lieuteunant James Carroll, Assistant Surgeon, U.S.
Army to a Major, Surgeon, U.S.Army, for the part he took in
these experiments. Major Carroll is still Curator of the Army
Medical Museum in this city, and professor of Bacteriology in
Mr. S. C. Meade - - - 2
the Army Medical School.

I have no information relative to the financial condition
of Mrs. Lazear, but the Government has only allowed her a pension
of $17 per month, and $2 additional for each of her two minor
children.
div1.closer: Very respectfully, Robert M. O'Reilly Surgeon General, U.S. Army.
